examples.zh: Clower 医生明天将在会议上发言。

examples.en: I met a woman named Ms. Clower at the library.
examples.zh: 我在图书馆遇到一位叫 Clower 女士的人。

definition.en: (rare/variant spelling) an old or nonstandard spelling of “clover,” a small plant with three leaves.
definition.zh: （罕见/变体拼写）“clover（三叶草）”的旧式或非标准拼写。

examples.en: In some older texts, you may see “clower” used where modern English uses “clover.”
examples.zh: 在一些较旧的文本里，你可能会看到用“clower”来表示现代英语中的“clover（三叶草）”。

extraExplanation: “Clower”在现代英语中最常见的用法是姓氏，因此通常首字母大写（Clower）。如果你是想查植物“三叶草”，更标准的拼写是“clover”。

summary.en: “Clower” is mainly a Scottish/Northern English dialect verb meaning to clamber up awkwardly, or to claw/scratch at something; it can also be a surname.
summary.zh: “clower”主要是苏格兰/英格兰北部方言动词，指笨拙地攀爬或用手抓挠；也可作姓氏。

definition.en: (Scotland, Northern England; dialect) to climb, scramble, or clamber in a rough or awkward way.
definition.zh: （苏格兰、英格兰北部方言）艰难地攀爬；笨拙地爬上去。

examples.en: The child clowered up the rocky bank to see the river.
examples.zh: 孩子艰难地爬上岩石河岸去看河。

examples.en: We clowered over the wall instead of using the gate.
examples.zh: 我们没走大门，而是翻墙爬了过去。

definition.en: (dialect) to claw at, scratch, or pull at something with your hands (sometimes while climbing).
definition.zh: （方言）用手抓、挠、扒拉（有时指一边攀爬一边抓）。

examples.en: He clowered at the ivy to get a better grip.
examples.zh: 他抓着常春藤好让自己站稳。

examples.en: The cat clowered the door until it opened.
examples.zh: 猫不停地抓门，直到门开了。

definition.en: a family name (surname).
definition.zh: 姓氏：Clower。

examples.en: Ms. Clower will lead today’s meeting.
examples.zh: Clower 女士将主持今天的会议。

extraExplanation: “clower”主要见于苏格兰英语与英格兰北部方言，属于地域性很强的词；在通用英语里更常用的是 climb / scramble / clamber（攀爬）以及 claw / scratch（抓挠）。
词形和“claw（爪子）”在感觉上相近，读起来也容易让人联想到“claw”，因此含有“用手抓着往上爬/乱抓”的画面感。

summary.en: Clown means a funny performer, or (informally) a foolish/annoying person; it can also mean to joke around.
summary.zh: Clown 指逗乐的表演者；口语里也可指愚蠢/惹人烦的人；还可表示“胡闹、打闹”。

definition.en: a performer (often in a circus or show) who wears funny clothes and makeup to make people laugh
definition.zh: 小丑；（常在马戏团或表演中）穿着滑稽服装和化妆来逗人笑的演员

examples.en: The clown made the children laugh with balloon animals.
examples.zh: 小丑用气球动物把孩子们逗笑了。

examples.en: She dressed as a clown for the costume party.
examples.zh: 她在化装舞会上打扮成小丑。

definition.en: a person who behaves in a silly, foolish, or annoying way (often an insult)
definition.zh: 傻瓜；举止愚蠢、幼稚或惹人烦的人（常带侮辱意味）

examples.en: Stop acting like a clown and take this seriously.
examples.zh: 别像个小丑一样了，认真点。

examples.en: He felt like a clown after making that mistake in front of everyone.
examples.zh: 他在大家面前犯了那个错后，觉得自己像个小丑。

definition.en: to behave in a silly way or joke around, especially when you should be serious
definition.zh: 胡闹；开玩笑打闹（尤指本该严肃的时候）

examples.en: They were clowning around in class instead of listening.
examples.zh: 他们在课上胡闹，没有认真听讲。

examples.en: Don’t clown around near the pool.
examples.zh: 别在泳池边胡闹。

extraExplanation: 在英语里，clown 既可以是“表演的小丑”，也常用作带贬义的称呼，意思接近“蠢货/丢人现眼的人”。日常交流中用来骂人会比较冲，和朋友玩笑时也要注意语气与关系。
常见搭配：clown around（胡闹）、act like a clown（像小丑一样）、clown makeup（小丑妆）。
文化提示：一些作品会把“小丑”塑造成恐怖形象（如某些电影/小说中的邪恶小丑），所以 clown 在部分语境里可能让人联想到“吓人”，不总是可爱搞笑。

summary.en: Clownade means clownish antics or a silly performance, often with a negative tone.
summary.zh: Clownade 指小丑式的滑稽举动或闹剧，常带贬义。

definition.en: a silly performance or prank; clownish behavior meant to amuse people (often used critically)
definition.zh: 滑稽表演或恶作剧；小丑式的举动（常带批评意味）

examples.en: The meeting was serious, but his loud clownade annoyed everyone.
examples.zh: 会议很严肃，但他大声的滑稽举动惹恼了所有人。

examples.en: The actor filled the scene with clownade instead of genuine emotion.
examples.zh: 这位演员用夸张的滑稽表演填满了场景，而不是真情流露。

extraExplanation: “clownade”在现代英语中相对少见，语气常偏贬义，暗示“耍宝过头、装疯卖傻、不合时宜”。在正式写作里更常见的替代词有“clowning”“buffoonery”“antics”。
词尾“-ade”有时可表示“某种行为/表演”，类似于把“clown（小丑）”变成“像小丑那样的一套动作/闹剧”。

summary.en: “Clownage” means silly, foolish, or embarrassing clown-like behavior (and sometimes, by extension, the people seen as clowns).
summary.zh: “clownage”指像小丑一样愚蠢、滑稽或尴尬的行为；有时也泛指一群被认为很可笑的人。

definition.en: (informal, often humorous or critical) Silly, foolish, or embarrassing behavior—especially when someone is acting like a clown.
definition.zh: （非正式，常带幽默或批评）愚蠢、滑稽或令人尴尬的行为；尤指像小丑一样在“耍宝/出洋相”。

examples.en: There was too much clownage in the meeting, so we couldn’t finish on time.
examples.zh: 会议上闹得太“耍宝”了，所以我们没能按时结束。

examples.en: Stop the clownage and take this seriously.
examples.zh: 别再胡闹了，认真点。

examples.en: The comment section is pure clownage today.
examples.zh: 今天的评论区简直就是大型翻车/胡闹现场。

definition.en: (slang) A person or group seen as ridiculous or incompetent; “clowns” as a collective idea.
definition.zh: （俚语）被认为很可笑或很不靠谱的人/一群人；把对方整体当作“ clown（小丑）”。

examples.en: Don’t listen to that clownage online—they’re just trying to provoke people.
examples.zh: 别理网上那群“跳梁小丑”，他们只是想挑事。

examples.en: The whole situation turned into clownage after the rumor spread.
examples.zh: 谣言传开后，整个局面变得一团荒唐。

extraExplanation: “clownage”是由“clown（小丑）+ -age（表示状态/行为/集合）”构成的口语词，常见于网络、吐槽和评论区，用来形容“很丢脸/很离谱/很幼稚”的行为或场面。
语气通常偏贬义，但也可以是朋友间半开玩笑的调侃；正式写作中不太适合，用“foolish behavior / ridiculous behavior / shenanigans”更稳妥。

summary.en: “Clowne” is an archaic spelling of “clown.”
summary.zh: “clowne”是“clown”的古拼写。

definition.en: (Archaic spelling) a clown; a comic entertainer, or a person who behaves in a silly way.
definition.zh: （古拼写）clown 的旧式拼法；小丑；也可指行为愚蠢、滑稽的人。

examples.en: In some old texts, “clowne” is simply an older spelling of “clown.”
examples.zh: 在一些旧文本里，“clowne”只是“clown”的旧式拼法。

examples.en: The clowne made the crowd laugh with jokes and exaggerated movements.
examples.zh: 那个“小丑”用笑话和夸张的动作逗得人群大笑。

extraExplanation: “clowne”常见于早期英语或仿古、文学风格的写法；现代英语几乎都写作“clown”。在莎士比亚等戏剧传统中，“clown”也可指“弄臣/滑稽角色”，不一定是穿着马戏团服装的那种小丑。

summary.en: “Clowned” means either (1) acted silly to entertain, or (2) (informal) mocked/embarrassed someone.
summary.zh: “clowned”既可指（1）耍宝逗乐，也可指（2）（口语）嘲笑/当众让人难堪。

definition.en: (Past tense/past participle of “clown”) To act like a clown; to behave in a silly or playful way to entertain others.
definition.zh: （clown 的过去式/过去分词）像小丑一样表演；用滑稽、搞笑的方式逗乐别人。

examples.en: He clowned around at the party to make everyone laugh.
examples.zh: 他在派对上装怪搞笑，逗大家笑。

examples.en: The teacher asked us to stop clowning and focus.
examples.zh: 老师让我们别再胡闹，专心一点。

definition.en: (Informal) To mock, embarrass, or make someone look foolish in front of others.
definition.zh: （非正式）嘲笑、当众让人难堪；把某人“整得很丢脸”。

examples.en: Don’t clown him online—just talk to him privately.
examples.zh: 别在网上嘲他了，私下跟他聊就好。

examples.en: She felt clowned after her mistake was turned into a joke.
examples.zh: 她的失误被拿来开玩笑后，觉得很难堪。

examples.en: They clowned the team for losing again.
examples.zh: 他们嘲笑那支队伍又输了。

extraExplanation: “clowned”作“嘲笑/让人难堪”时很口语，常见于网络语境，也常出现在黑人英语（AAVE）与嘻哈/梗文化里。语气可能较尖刻，正式写作中更常用“mock / ridicule / embarrass”。
常见搭配：clown around（胡闹、耍宝）；clown on someone（嘲某人、整某人）；get clowned（被嘲/被整）。

summary.en: Clowneries means silly clown-like behavior, or clown-style jokes and routines.
summary.zh: clowneries 指小丑般的胡闹行为，或小丑式的笑料与表演套路。

definition.en: Silly or clown-like behavior; playful joking or foolish actions (often used to criticize someone for not being serious).
definition.zh: 小丑般的行为；滑稽胡闹的举动（常带批评语气，指不够严肃）。

examples.en: The meeting was delayed because of a few people’s clowneries.
examples.zh: 会议被耽搁了，因为有几个人一直在胡闹。

examples.en: Save the clowneries for after class.
examples.zh: 把那些搞笑胡闹留到下课后再说。

examples.en: His clowneries made the children laugh, but the adults looked annoyed.
examples.zh: 他的滑稽举动逗得孩子们大笑，但大人们看起来有点不耐烦。

definition.en: Actions, jokes, or routines typical of a clown or clown performance; clowning as entertainment.
definition.zh: （像小丑表演那样的）滑稽动作、笑料或套路；小丑式表演。

examples.en: The circus was full of clowneries and acrobatics.
examples.zh: 马戏团里满是小丑表演和杂技。

examples.en: The actor is known for physical clowneries on stage.
examples.zh: 这位演员以舞台上的肢体搞笑表演而出名。

extraExplanation: “clowneries”是名词复数，单数是“clownery”。日常表达里常带轻微贬义，强调“幼稚、不得体、不够认真”；如果是在马戏或舞台语境里则更中性，指“逗乐的表演”。

summary.en: “Clownery” means silly, attention-seeking, or ridiculous behavior (sometimes playful, often critical).
summary.zh: “clownery”指滑稽、博眼球或荒唐的行为；可逗趣，也常带批评意味。

definition.en: Silly or foolish behavior (often done to get attention), sometimes seen as embarrassing or ridiculous; can be playful or insulting depending on context.
definition.zh: （常为博关注的）滑稽、愚蠢的行为；有时带贬义，指让人觉得尴尬或可笑；也可能带点玩笑意味。

examples.en: The comments section turned into pure clownery after the rumor spread.
examples.zh: 谣言传开后，评论区彻底变成了一场“闹剧/小丑行为”。

examples.en: Stop the clownery and talk seriously for a minute.
examples.zh: 别再搞这些小丑行为了，认真说一分钟。

examples.en: Their playful clownery made the kids laugh.
examples.zh: 他们逗趣的搞怪举动把孩子们逗笑了。

extraExplanation: “clownery”是由“clown（小丑）+ -ery（表示某种行为/状态）”构成的口语/网络用词，在社交媒体上很常见。
语气强弱取决于场景：朋友间可半开玩笑；在争吵或批评中则更像“你在丢人/胡闹”。
常见搭配：pure/total clownery（纯纯的闹剧）、stop the clownery（别胡闹）、engage in clownery（做小丑事/胡来）。

summary.en: “Clownheal” is an informal online/gaming term meaning silly, ineffective, or clown-like healing/support.
summary.zh: “clownheal”多为网络/游戏里的非标准词，指滑稽、无效、像小丑一样的治疗或支援。

definition.en: (informal, online; not a standard dictionary word) to heal or provide support in a silly, clown-like, or unprofessional way; sometimes used jokingly to criticize someone’s healing/support skills in a game or situation.
definition.zh: （非标准词，常见于网络语境）用很“像小丑一样”的方式治疗/支援；也可用来调侃或批评某人的治疗（奶）水平很滑稽、很不靠谱。

examples.en: Stop clownhealing and focus on the tank—he’s about to go down!
examples.zh: 别再小丑式乱奶了，专心奶坦克——他快倒了！

examples.en: I was clownhealing all match because I didn’t know the controls.
examples.zh: 我整局都在小丑式乱奶，因为我不熟悉操作。

definition.en: a joking label for clown-like healing/support (especially in gaming).
definition.zh: （玩笑说法）小丑式治疗/支援（常指游戏里乱奶、无效治疗）。

examples.en: That wasn’t healing—it was pure clownheal.
examples.zh: 那根本不叫治疗——纯纯小丑式乱奶。

extraExplanation: “clownheal/clownhealing”并不是常见英语标准词，更像是把“clown（小丑、出丑的人）+ heal（治疗/奶）”拼在一起的吐槽词，常见于玩家聊天或弹幕。
如果你想表达更常见、更地道的说法，可以用：“bad healing / sloppy healing（治疗很差/很乱）”“throwing（在送/在摆烂）”“trolling（恶搞/捣乱）”。
如果这是用户名、技能名或特定游戏里的术语，不同社区可能有更具体含义；你可以告诉我出处（哪款游戏/哪句话），我能给更精确的解释。

summary.en: “Clowning” means acting silly or joking around; it can be a noun (the behavior) or the -ing form of “clown.”
summary.zh: “clowning”指装傻搞怪、开玩笑/胡闹；既可作名词指这种行为，也可作动词clown的-ing形式。

definition.en: the act of behaving in a silly or playful way; joking around (often to entertain others, sometimes to avoid being serious)
definition.zh: （为逗乐或不严肃对待事情而）装傻、搞怪、胡闹

examples.en: Stop clowning and finish your homework.
examples.zh: 别再胡闹了，把作业写完。

examples.en: They were clowning around in the hallway before class.
examples.zh: 上课前他们在走廊里打闹搞怪。

examples.en: I know you’re nervous, but clowning won’t help right now.
examples.zh: 我知道你紧张，但现在搞怪并不能解决问题。

definition.en: acting like a clown; behaving in a silly or joking way (present participle of “clown”)
definition.zh: 像小丑一样逗笑；装傻、开玩笑（“clown”的现在分词）

examples.en: He kept clowning during the meeting and annoyed his coworkers.
examples.zh: 他在会议上一直搞怪，把同事都惹烦了。

examples.en: She was just clowning when she said she could run 100 miles.
examples.zh: 她说自己能跑100英里只是开玩笑而已。

definition.en: informal: not serious; joking or messing around (often used in questions or short comments)
definition.zh: （非正式）不当真、在开玩笑/瞎闹（常用于问句或简短评价）

examples.en: Are you clowning right now?
examples.zh: 你现在是在开玩笑吗？

examples.en: I’m not clowning—this is important to me.
examples.zh: 我不是在闹着玩——这对我很重要。

extraExplanation: “clowning around”是最常见的搭配，意思是“嘻嘻哈哈、打闹、胡闹”。语气通常偏轻松，但在正式场合（课堂、会议）会带一点“别闹了”的不满。
在一些网络/口语语境里，“Are you clowning?”常带有“你是认真的吗/你在耍我吗”的质疑语气，注意根据语境选择更礼貌的说法。

summary.en: Clownish means silly or awkward like a clown—sometimes funny, but often immature or not serious.
summary.zh: Clownish 指“像小丑一样滑稽笨拙”，可能好笑，但常带“不成熟/不严肃”的语气。

definition.en: Silly or awkward in a way that is meant to be funny (like a clown), often slightly embarrassing.
definition.zh: 像小丑一样的；滑稽可笑的（常带点尴尬或不太得体）。

examples.en: His clownish dance moves made everyone laugh.
examples.zh: 他那滑稽的舞步把大家都逗笑了。

examples.en: She apologized for her clownish behavior during the meeting.
examples.zh: 她为自己在会议上的滑稽失态道了歉。

definition.en: Not serious or mature; foolish in a way that can seem disrespectful.
definition.zh: 不严肃的；幼稚愚蠢的（有时会显得不尊重）。

examples.en: Stop making clownish jokes when we’re discussing something important.
examples.zh: 我们在讨论重要的事时，别再开那种不正经的玩笑了。

examples.en: The article criticized the clownish comments made by the politician.
examples.zh: 那篇文章批评了那位政客不严肃、很不得体的言论。

extraExplanation: “clownish”通常比“funny”更负面一些：强调“像小丑一样夸张、笨拙或不合时宜”，可能让人笑，但也可能显得幼稚、失礼。
搭配提示：常见于“clownish behavior/antics/jokes/grin”（滑稽的行为/胡闹/玩笑/傻笑）。如果你想表达更中性的“搞笑”，也可以用“playful”“goofy”。

summary.en: Clownishly means doing something in a clown-like, foolish, or awkward way.
summary.zh: clownishly 指“像小丑一样”做事：夸张、笨拙或显得很傻。

definition.en: In a silly, awkward, or exaggerated way, like a clown; often implying someone looks or behaves foolishly.
definition.zh: 以小丑般的方式；愚蠢、笨拙或夸张地（常带贬义，表示看起来或表现得很可笑）。

examples.en: He waved clownishly at the camera and everyone laughed.
examples.zh: 他对着镜头小丑般地挥手，大家都笑了。

examples.en: The suit fit him clownishly, with sleeves that were far too long.
examples.zh: 那套西装穿在他身上显得很滑稽，袖子长得离谱。

examples.en: She smiled clownishly to hide her nervousness.
examples.zh: 她用夸张的傻笑来掩饰紧张。

extraExplanation: “clownishly”来自形容词“clownish”（像小丑的、滑稽笨拙的）+ 副词后缀“-ly”。语气通常偏负面，强调“出丑/不体面/不得体”，不等同于更中性的“playfully（顽皮地）”或更正面的“humorously（幽默地）”。

summary.en: Clownishness means silly, clown-like behavior, often seen as awkward or inappropriate.
summary.zh: Clownishness 指小丑式的愚蠢/不得体的滑稽行为，常带贬义。

definition.en: The quality of behaving like a clown; silly, awkward, or inappropriate humor that makes someone seem foolish rather than funny.
definition.zh: 小丑式的举止；指愚蠢、笨拙或不合时宜的搞笑，让人显得可笑（而不一定有趣）。

examples.en: His clownishness during the meeting annoyed his coworkers.
examples.zh: 他在会议上的小丑式胡闹惹恼了同事。

examples.en: The film relies too much on clownishness instead of real character development.
examples.zh: 这部电影太依赖滑稽胡闹，而不是扎实的人物塑造。

extraExplanation: “clownishness”常带有负面评价，强调“不得体/不成熟”的滑稽；如果是善意的、有魅力的搞笑，英语里更常用“playfulness（俏皮）”“goofiness（傻气但可爱）”。
词形结构：clown（小丑）+ -ish（有点像……的）→ clownish（像小丑的）+ -ness（……的特质）→ clownishness（小丑式特质）。

summary.en: Clownishnesses means multiple instances or kinds of clownish (silly, awkward, sometimes rude) behavior.
summary.zh: clownishnesses 指多次或多种“装小丑式”的胡闹/耍宝行为，常带贬义。

definition.en: the plural form of *clownishness*; instances or examples of silly, awkward, or rude behavior meant to be funny (often in a negative way).
definition.zh: *clownishness* 的复数；指多次/多种“装小丑式”的举动：愚蠢、笨拙或粗鲁却想逗笑人的行为（常带贬义）。

examples.en: The teacher was patient, but the clownishnesses in class finally had to stop.
examples.zh: 老师很有耐心，但课堂上的那些胡闹行为最后必须停止。

examples.en: In the interview, he avoided clownishnesses and answered seriously.
examples.zh: 在面试中，他避免耍宝胡闹，认真作答。

definition.en: different kinds of exaggerated joking or foolish conduct, especially when it feels childish or disrespectful.
definition.zh: 各种夸张的玩笑或愚蠢举止，尤其当它显得幼稚或不尊重人时。

examples.en: The movie mixes heartfelt moments with a few unnecessary clownishnesses.
examples.zh: 这部电影把走心的片段和一些多余的耍宝桥段混在一起。

extraExplanation: “clownishnesses”= clownish + ness + es：clownish（像小丑的、滑稽的）加上名词后缀 -ness（……的性质/状态），再加复数 -es。日常英语里更常用不可数的 “clownishness”，复数形式多见于写作中，用来强调“多次/多种表现”。

summary.en: “Clownize” means to ridicule someone (make them look like a clown) or to act in a clownish way.
summary.zh: “clownize”表示“丑化/嘲弄使其像小丑”，也可指“扮小丑、耍宝”。

definition.en: (often informal, sometimes negative) To make someone or something look like a clown; to ridicule or turn into a joke.
definition.zh: （常为非正式用法，偶带贬义）把某人/某事弄得像小丑一样；嘲弄、丑化，使其显得很可笑。

examples.en: The meme was meant to clownize the politician after his mistake.
examples.zh: 这张梗图是想在他犯错后丑化那位政客。

examples.en: Don’t clownize your own work with messy formatting—present it clearly.
examples.zh: 别用乱七八糟的排版把自己的作品弄得很掉价——清楚呈现就好。

definition.en: To act like a clown; to behave in a silly, attention-seeking way.
definition.zh: 扮小丑；以夸张、愚蠢的方式博取注意。

examples.en: He started clownizing in class to make his friends laugh.
examples.zh: 他在课堂上开始扮小丑逗朋友笑。

examples.en: If you keep clownizing at the meeting, people won’t take you seriously.
examples.zh: 你如果在会议上一直耍宝，大家就不会认真对待你。

extraExplanation: “clownize”由“clown（小丑）+ -ize（使成为……）”构成，属于比较口语/网络化的动词，用来强调“把……变成笑柄”或“像小丑一样表现”。在正式写作中更常用“mock / ridicule / make a fool of”。

summary.en: “Clowns” is the plural of “clown”: a comedic performer, or (informally) a foolish person; it can also be a verb meaning to joke around.
summary.zh: “clowns”是“clown”的复数：指逗乐的表演者；也可（非正式）指愚蠢的人；作动词可表示胡闹、开玩笑。

definition.en: A person who performs comedy (often in a circus or show), usually wearing funny makeup and clothes to entertain people.
definition.zh: 小丑；（常在马戏团或表演中）穿着夸张服装、化妆来逗乐观众的喜剧表演者。

examples.en: The kids laughed when the clown made balloon animals.
examples.zh: 小朋友看到小丑做气球动物时笑了。

examples.en: She hired clowns for the birthday party.
examples.zh: 她为生日派对请了小丑。

definition.en: Someone who behaves in a silly or foolish way and is not taken seriously (sometimes mildly insulting).
definition.zh: 行为滑稽或愚蠢、让人不当回事的人（有时带轻微贬义）。

examples.en: Stop acting like a clown and focus on your work.
examples.zh: 别像个小丑一样闹了，专心工作。

examples.en: He felt like a clown after telling the wrong story in the meeting.
examples.zh: 他在会上讲错故事后，觉得自己像个小丑。

definition.en: To behave in a playful, silly way; to joke around.
definition.zh: （非正式）扮丑逗乐；胡闹；开玩笑。

examples.en: They were clowning around in the hallway.
examples.zh: 他们在走廊里打闹逗乐。

examples.en: Don’t clown during the presentation.
examples.zh: 演示的时候别胡闹。

extraExplanation: “clown”既可以是中性职业名词（马戏团小丑），也常用作比喻，表示“出洋相/不靠谱的人”，语气可能带嘲讽，使用时注意场合。
常见搭配：clown around（胡闹、打闹）、clown face（小丑脸/小丑妆，较口语）、clown car（小丑车，常用来形容挤满人的小车）。
文化提示：英语里“clown”在恐怖题材中也会被用来制造“诡异小丑”的形象（如一些电影/小说），所以有时会引发“怕小丑”的联想。

summary.en: Clownship means clown-like behavior or the role/state of being a clown, often said humorously or slightly critically.
summary.zh: Clownship 指“小丑式的行为/表演”或“当小丑的身份与状态”，常带玩笑或轻微批评的语气。

definition.en: the behavior, style, or performance of a clown; clowning, especially in a showy or silly way
definition.zh: 小丑的行为/风格/表演方式；（尤指夸张、滑稽的）扮小丑、耍宝

examples.en: His clownship kept the audience laughing between songs.
examples.zh: 他耍宝式的表演让观众在歌曲之间一直笑个不停。

examples.en: The film balances real emotion with a touch of clownship.
examples.zh: 这部电影在真实情感与一点点“扮小丑”的喜剧感之间取得了平衡。

definition.en: the condition or role of being a clown (often used humorously or in a slightly critical tone)
definition.zh: 当小丑的身份/角色；（常带玩笑或轻微批评语气）小丑式处境

examples.en: He refused to be pushed into clownship just to please the boss.
examples.zh: 他不愿为了讨好老板而被迫扮成小丑。

examples.en: Online fame can tempt people into permanent clownship.
examples.zh: 网络名气可能诱使人陷入一种“永久耍宝”的状态。

extraExplanation: “clownship”不是非常常见的词，更常见的说法是“clowning”（耍宝/扮小丑）或“buffoonery”（更偏贬义的胡闹、滑稽行径）。
后缀“-ship”常表示“身份、状态或技能/技艺”（如 friendship 友谊、leadership 领导力）。因此 clownship 可理解为“小丑这一身份/状态/技艺”。
语气上，“clownship”往往带一点讽刺或夸张的味道，用来评价某人过度搞笑、为了取悦他人而显得不够庄重。

summary.en: Clowre is an archaic/dialect verb meaning “to cower,” and more rarely “to look dark or gloomy.”
summary.zh: clowre 是古语/方言动词，常指“畏缩”，较少见可指“（表情或天空）阴沉”。

definition.en: (archaic/dialect) To crouch down or shrink back in fear; to cower.
definition.zh: （古语/方言）因害怕而蜷缩、退缩；畏缩。

examples.en: The child clowre(d) behind the door when he heard the thunder.
examples.zh: 孩子听到雷声就躲到门后面畏缩起来。

examples.en: He would clowre in the corner whenever the dog barked.
examples.zh: 每次狗一叫，他就会缩在角落里。

definition.en: (rare) To look dark or gloomy; to be overcast (often said of weather or a person’s expression).
definition.zh: （罕见）显得阴沉、忧郁；（天气）变得阴天。

examples.en: The sky began to clowre before the storm arrived.
examples.zh: 暴风雨来之前，天空开始变得阴沉。

examples.en: His face clowred at the news.
examples.zh: 听到消息后，他的脸色沉了下来。

extraExplanation: “clowre”多见于古英语/方言拼写，现代英语里更常用的是“cower（畏缩）”或“glower（怒目而视、阴沉地看）”。有时它在旧文本里会和“lower（阴沉、（天空）变暗）”的意义范围接近，因此不同语境下含义可能偏向“畏缩”或“阴沉”。
如果你是在某段原文里看到“clowre”，可以把句子发来；我可以根据上下文判断更贴近哪一种意思。

summary.en: “Clowring” is probably a misspelling of “clowering,” meaning dark, angry-looking, or threatening; it can describe a person’s expression or even clouds.
summary.zh: “clowring”很可能是“clowering”的拼写错误，表示神情阴沉、怒气冲冲或带威胁感；既可形容人的表情，也常形容乌云等天气。

definition.en: (Likely intended: “clowering”) Looking dark, angry, or threatening; frowning in a gloomy way.
definition.zh: （多半是想写：clowering）阴沉的；怒气冲冲的；带威胁感地皱眉的。

examples.en: He walked into the room with a clowering expression.
examples.zh: 他走进房间时一脸阴沉。

examples.en: Clowering clouds gathered over the hills.
examples.zh: 乌云阴沉地聚集在山丘上。

examples.en: She gave me a clowering look, and I stopped talking.
examples.zh: 她阴沉地瞪了我一眼，我就不说话了。

definition.en: Present participle of “clower”: to look at someone in a dark, angry, or threatening way (similar to “glower”).
definition.zh: “clower”的现在分词：阴沉、愤怒或带威胁地看（类似 glower）。

examples.en: He stood by the door, clowering at everyone who passed.
examples.zh: 他站在门旁，阴沉地盯着每个经过的人。

examples.en: The boss was clowering all morning because of the mistake.
examples.zh: 老板因为那个错误一上午都脸色阴沉。

extraExplanation: “clowring”不是常见拼写，最可能是把“clowering”拼错了；“clowering”来自动词“clower”（较少见），意思接近更常用的“glower”（怒视、阴沉地瞪）。
在文学描写中，“clowering”也常用来形容天气（如乌云、天空）显得压抑、风暴将至的氛围。

summary.en: Cloxacillin is a penicillin-type antibiotic used mainly for certain staph (staphylococcal) infections.
summary.zh: Cloxacillin（氯唑西林）是一种青霉素类抗生素，主要用于治疗某些葡萄球菌感染。

definition.en: an antibiotic in the penicillin family used to treat infections caused by certain bacteria (especially staphylococci), and designed to resist breakdown by penicillinase (an enzyme that makes some bacteria resistant to penicillin)
definition.zh: 一种青霉素类抗生素，用于治疗某些细菌（尤其是葡萄球菌）引起的感染；其特点是能抵抗青霉素酶（会使部分细菌对青霉素产生耐药的酶）的分解

examples.en: The doctor prescribed cloxacillin for a suspected staph skin infection.
examples.zh: 医生为疑似葡萄球菌引起的皮肤感染开了氯唑西林。

examples.en: Cloxacillin is not effective against viral illnesses like the common cold.
examples.zh: 氯唑西林对普通感冒等病毒性疾病无效。

examples.en: Take cloxacillin exactly as directed and finish the full course.
examples.zh: 请严格按医嘱服用氯唑西林，并完成整个疗程。

extraExplanation: “cloxacillin（氯唑西林）”属于“抗青霉素酶青霉素”（penicillinase-resistant penicillin）一类，常用于对甲氧西林敏感的金黄色葡萄球菌（MSSA）感染；但对耐甲氧西林金黄色葡萄球菌（MRSA）通常无效。
这是药物专有名词，日常英语里多见于处方、药品说明或医学语境。用药问题需遵医嘱（例如是否空腹、疗程长度、过敏史等）。

summary.en: To cloy means to become or make something unpleasant because it is too sweet, rich, or excessive.
summary.zh: cloy 指因过甜、过腻或过度而让人倒胃口或厌倦。

definition.en: (Often about food, smells, or compliments) to become unpleasant because it is too sweet, rich, or excessive; to make someone feel tired of something by having too much of it.
definition.zh: （常指食物、气味或赞美）因过甜、过腻或过度而变得令人不适/倒胃口；（因过量）使人厌倦。

examples.en: After a few bites, the cake started to cloy—it was just too sweet.
examples.zh: 吃了几口后，这块蛋糕就开始让人觉得腻了——实在太甜。

examples.en: Her constant praise began to cloy, even though she meant well.
examples.zh: 尽管她是好意，但她不停的夸奖开始让人觉得腻/烦。

examples.en: The perfume was lovely at first, but it soon cloyed in the heat.
examples.zh: 这款香水一开始很迷人，但在炎热中很快就变得熏人、让人受不了。

extraExplanation: “cloy”常用于较正式或文学一点的语境，强调“甜到发腻/多到让人反感”的感觉，不一定只限于食物，也可指情感、赞美、香味等“过度”的东西。
常见搭配：cloying sweetness（腻人的甜味）、to cloy the palate（使味觉发腻）、too sweet to the point of cloying（甜得发腻）。
词源上与“钉子/堵塞”有关，引申为“使（味觉/感受）被‘堵住’、失去兴趣”。

summary.en: Cloyed means “too sweet/rich or overly sentimental in an unpleasant way,” and it can also mean “to make someone feel sick of something by overdoing it.”
summary.zh: cloyed 指“甜得发腻/过于浓腻或过分煽情而令人不适”，也可作动词表示“（因过量）使人发腻、倒胃口”。

definition.en: Sickeningly sweet, rich, or sentimental; too much in a way that becomes unpleasant.
definition.zh: （甜味、浓郁感或感情表达）甜得发腻/腻人；过度而令人不舒服。

examples.en: The cake was so sweet it tasted cloyed after a few bites.
examples.zh: 这个蛋糕太甜了，吃了几口就觉得甜得发腻。

examples.en: He disliked cloyed romance in movies and preferred more realistic stories.
examples.zh: 他不喜欢电影里那种腻人的爱情，更偏爱真实一点的故事。

definition.en: To fill or satisfy too much, especially with sweetness or richness, so that it becomes unpleasant or tiresome.
definition.zh: （使）过度满足；（尤指甜腻）使人发腻、倒胃口。

examples.en: Too many desserts can cloy the appetite.
examples.zh: 甜点吃太多会让人倒胃口。

examples.en: The perfume cloyed in the hot air.
examples.zh: 在热空气里，这香水味变得浓腻刺人。

extraExplanation: “cloy”常用于味觉/嗅觉（甜、香、油腻）和情感表达（过分煽情）。语气通常偏负面，表示“过犹不及”。
词源上与“钉子/楔子（cloy）”的旧义有关，有“堵住、卡住”的感觉，后来引申为“吃（闻/感受）得太多而腻”。
常见搭配：cloying sweetness（腻人的甜）、cloying perfume（甜腻的香味）、cloying sentimentality（过分煽情）。

summary.en: Cloyedness means an unpleasant “too much” feeling—especially too sweet, rich, or overly sentimental.
summary.zh: Cloyedness 指“过犹不及”的不适感，尤指甜得发腻、浓得发闷或过度煽情而令人厌倦。

definition.en: the quality of being too sweet, rich, or sentimental in a way that becomes unpleasant or tiring
definition.zh: （味道、情感、文字等）甜腻感；过分浓重或过度煽情而令人不适、厌倦的感觉

examples.en: After a few bites, the cake’s cloyedness became hard to ignore.
examples.zh: 吃了几口后，这蛋糕的甜腻感让人很难忽视。

examples.en: Some viewers complained about the movie’s cloyedness and predictable romance.
examples.zh: 有些观众抱怨这部电影过于煽情、套路化的爱情令人厌倦。

examples.en: The perfume had a cloyedness that made the room feel heavy.
examples.zh: 这款香水的浓甜味让房间显得很闷。

extraExplanation: “cloyedness”来自动词/形容词“cloy / cloying”，常见搭配包括：cloying sweetness（甜得发腻）、cloying sentimentality（过度煽情）。它既可描述味觉（食物太甜太腻），也常用于评价文字、广告、电影等“情感过度、令人腻烦”。
词形提示：cloy（v. 使……腻；使……厌倦）→ cloying（adj. 甜腻的；令人厌烦的）→ cloyedness（n. 甜腻/厌腻的程度）。在现代英语中更常见的是“cloying”或“cloyingness”，但“cloyedness”也可以使用，语气较书面。

summary.en: “Cloyer” is a rare noun meaning a person or thing that makes you feel sick of something because it’s too sweet, rich, or excessive.
summary.zh: “cloyer”是罕见名词，指因过甜、过浓或过度而让人感到“发腻/厌倦”的人或事物。

definition.en: (rare) A person or thing that cloys—something that becomes too sweet, rich, or pleasant and makes you feel tired of it.
definition.zh: （罕见）使人“腻/厌”的人或事物；指甜得发腻、过于浓重或过度讨好而让人感到厌倦的东西/人。

examples.en: The constant compliments felt like a cloyer after a while.
examples.zh: 不停的夸奖过了一会儿就让人觉得很腻。

examples.en: For her, the perfume was a cloyer—too sweet and heavy.
examples.zh: 对她来说，那款香水太甜太浓，闻久了发腻。

extraExplanation: “cloyer”在现代英语中非常少见，很多情况下是把常用动词“cloy”（使发腻/使厌倦）误写成了名词形式。更常见的表达是：a cloying smell（甜腻的气味）、It cloys（让人发腻）、Too much sweetness can cloy（太甜会让人腻）。
如果你想表达“回廊/修道院”，可能想写的是“cloister”（/ˈklɔɪstər/）。

summary.en: Cloying describes something overly sweet, rich, or sentimental to the point of being unpleasant; it can also describe a heavy, sickly smell or atmosphere.
summary.zh: Cloying 指甜味/浓度/煽情过度而腻人、让人不适；也可指气味或氛围浓重发闷、甜得令人作呕。

definition.en: Too sweet, rich, or sentimental in a way that becomes unpleasant and makes you feel you’ve had “too much.”
definition.zh: （甜味、浓度或感情表达）过于腻人/过于甜腻，以至于让人不舒服、觉得“太过了”。

examples.en: The cake looked beautiful, but the frosting was so cloying that I couldn’t finish a slice.
examples.zh: 蛋糕看起来很漂亮，但糖霜甜得发腻，我一块都吃不完。

examples.en: The movie’s ending felt cloying, with too much forced sweetness and sentiment.
examples.zh: 电影结局显得过于煽情甜腻，刻意的温情太多。

definition.en: (Of a smell or atmosphere) heavy and sickly, often because it is too sweet or too strong.
definition.zh: （气味或氛围）浓重而令人作呕/发闷，常因过甜或过强。

examples.en: A cloying perfume hung in the small room.
examples.zh: 狭小的房间里弥漫着一股甜腻浓重的香水味。

examples.en: The air was cloying in the crowded subway car.
examples.zh: 拥挤的地铁车厢里空气闷得发腻。

extraExplanation: “Cloying”常用来形容两类“让人受不了的过量”：①味觉上的甜腻（sugary/rich）；②情感表达上的过度煽情（overly sentimental）。语气通常偏负面。
常见搭配：cloying sweetness（甜得发腻）、cloying perfume（浓甜的香水味）、cloying sentimentality（过度煽情）、cloying romantic scenes（甜到腻的恋爱桥段）。
同义词细微差别：sickly sweet 更强调“甜到让人反胃”；overly sentimental 更中性直白；cloying 则兼有“甜腻/黏滞、过量”的感觉。

summary.en: “Cloyingly” means “in an unpleasantly excessive way,” especially too sweet or too sentimental.
summary.zh: “cloyingly”表示“过度到令人不舒服的”，常指甜得发腻或煽情/肉麻过头。

definition.en: In an unpleasantly sweet, sentimental, or excessive way (so much that it becomes annoying).
definition.zh: 以甜得发腻、矫情过头或过分到令人不舒服/厌烦的方式。

examples.en: The dessert was cloyingly sweet, and I couldn’t finish it.
examples.zh: 这甜点甜得发腻，我吃不完。

examples.en: He wrote a cloyingly romantic message that felt a bit fake.
examples.zh: 他写了一段过分肉麻的情话，让人觉得有点假。

examples.en: The movie’s ending was cloyingly sentimental.
examples.zh: 这部电影的结尾煽情过头，显得腻。

extraExplanation: “cloyingly”来自形容词“cloying”（甜腻的/令人厌烦的）。它最常见的搭配是“cloyingly sweet”（甜得发腻）和“cloyingly sentimental”（过分煽情）。
它常用于评价“过度的美好”：不仅是味道太甜，也可以指情感表达太肉麻、广告太煽情、香水味太浓等，带有明显的负面语气。
近似表达：“sickeningly sweet”（甜得恶心/腻得慌，语气更强）、“overly sweet”（太甜，较中性）、“too sentimental”（太煽情）。

summary.en: Cloyingness means an unpleasant “too much” sweetness, richness, or sentimentality.
summary.zh: Cloyingness 指“甜到发腻/浓到腻人”或“煽情过头”带来的不适感。

definition.en: the quality of being too sweet, rich, or sentimental in a way that becomes unpleasant or tiring
definition.zh: 过于甜腻、浓重或过分煽情而让人感到不适或厌烦的特质

examples.en: The cake’s cloyingness made it hard to finish even one slice.
examples.zh: 蛋糕的甜腻感让人连一片都很难吃完。

examples.en: Some readers disliked the cloyingness of the love story.
examples.zh: 一些读者不喜欢这段爱情故事的过分煽情。

extraExplanation: “cloyingness”来自形容词“cloying”（甜到发腻/腻人的），常用在食物（甜点、香水味道）或情感表达（台词、剧情）上，强调“过量导致反感”，语气通常偏负面。
更常见的表达是直接用“cloying”作形容词（a cloying dessert / cloying sentiment）。名词“cloyingness”较少见，但在评论、文学批评或较正式写作中会出现。

summary.en: “Cloyless” means pleasantly not too sweet, rich, or overly sentimental.
summary.zh: “cloyless”指清爽不腻（不甜腻、不浓腻），也可指表达不矫情、不过分煽情。

definition.en: Not cloying; pleasant because it is not too sweet, rich, or overly sentimental.
definition.zh: 不腻人的；不甜腻的；（感情表达等）不矫情、不让人反感的。

examples.en: The dessert is light and cloyless, with just a hint of honey.
examples.zh: 这道甜点很清爽不腻，只带一点点蜂蜜的甜味。

examples.en: She wrote a love letter that was warm and cloyless.
examples.zh: 她写的情书很温暖，却不矫情。

examples.en: The perfume smells floral but cloyless, even in hot weather.
examples.zh: 这款香水有花香，但即使在炎热天气里也不甜腻。

extraExplanation: “cloyless”来自动词/形容词“cloy / cloying”（甜腻到发齁、让人厌烦）。在美食评论、香水描述、以及评价文字或电影“不过分煽情”时偶尔会用到。日常口语中更常见的说法是“not too sweet / not cloying / not overly sentimental”。

summary.en: Cloyment means the unpleasant feeling of having too much of something, leading to boredom or disgust.
summary.zh: Cloyment 指因某物过量而产生的发腻、厌倦甚至反感的感觉。

definition.en: a feeling of being too full, tired of, or even disgusted with something because you have had too much of it (food, sweetness, attention, praise, etc.)
definition.zh: （因过量而产生的）腻、厌、饱足到反感的感觉（可指食物太甜/太多，也可指关注、赞美等过度）

examples.en: After three rich desserts, a heavy cloyment set in and I couldn’t take another bite.
examples.zh: 连吃了三份浓甜的甜点后，一阵发腻的饱足感涌上来，我再也吃不下了。

examples.en: The constant compliments turned from pleasant to cloyment, and she wanted some quiet.
examples.zh: 不断的夸奖从令人愉快变成了令人发腻的负担，她只想清静一会儿。

extraExplanation: “cloyment”来自动词“cloy”（使发腻、使厌倦）。它在现代英语中比较少见，常见替代说法有“satiation / disgust / too much of a good thing”等。
在文学或较正式的写作里，用“cloyment”能强调“甜腻到让人反感”的那种强烈感觉，尤其适合描写过度甜腻、过度殷勤或过度感官刺激。

summary.en: Cloyne is a proper noun referring mainly to a town in County Cork, Ireland, and sometimes to the Diocese of Cloyne.
summary.zh: Cloyne 是专有名词，主要指爱尔兰科克郡的克洛因镇，有时也指克洛因教区。

definition.en: A small town in County Cork, southern Ireland (also the name of the surrounding area).
definition.zh: 爱尔兰南部科克郡的一个小镇（也可指周边地区）。

examples.en: Cloyne is a quiet town in County Cork, not far from the coast.
examples.zh: 克洛因是科克郡的一个安静小镇，离海岸不远。

examples.en: We drove from Cork city to Cloyne in the afternoon.
examples.zh: 下午我们从科克市开车去了克洛因。

definition.en: The title used in some religious contexts, referring to the (Roman Catholic / Church of Ireland) Diocese of Cloyne.
definition.zh: 在某些宗教语境中指“克洛因教区”（天主教或爱尔兰国教会的教区名）。

examples.en: He served in the Diocese of Cloyne for several years.
examples.zh: 他在克洛因教区服事了好几年。

examples.en: The Bishop of Cloyne is mentioned in historical records.
examples.zh: 历史记录中提到了克洛因主教。

extraExplanation: “Cloyne”常让学习者困惑的一点是：它主要是专有名词（地名/教区名），一般不翻译成普通词义来理解。
在文学与思想史上，“Cloyne”也会因哲学家乔治·贝克莱（George Berkeley）而被提及：他曾任“Bishop of Cloyne（克洛因主教）”。如果你在文章里看到这个搭配，多半是在说贝克莱或相关历史背景。

summary.en: “Cloys” means something pleasant becomes too much and starts to feel sickening or tiresome; it can also mean to disgust someone by excess.
summary.zh: “cloys”表示原本愉快的事物因过量而变得腻人/令人厌烦；也可指因过度而使人反感。

definition.en: (of something pleasant) to become too much, so it starts to feel boring, unpleasant, or sickening—often used about sweetness, rich food, perfume, or praise.
definition.zh: （原本令人愉快的事物）因过量而变得腻人、令人厌烦或反感；常用于甜味、油腻食物、香水味或过度称赞。

examples.en: At first the dessert was delicious, but the sweetness soon cloys.
examples.zh: 一开始甜点很好吃，但甜味很快就变得腻人了。

examples.en: Her constant praise cloys after a while.
examples.zh: 她没完没了的夸奖，过一会儿就让人觉得腻烦。

definition.en: to make someone feel disgusted or tired of something by giving too much of it.
definition.zh: （因给予过多而）使人感到厌恶或生腻。

examples.en: Too much perfume can cloy the senses.
examples.zh: 香水喷得太多会让感官觉得腻、难受。

examples.en: A steady diet of compliments can cloy even a confident person.
examples.zh: 持续不断的恭维就算是自信的人也会听腻。

extraExplanation: “cloy”常见搭配有：cloying sweetness（腻人的甜）、cloying perfume（浓得发腻的香味）、cloying praise/sentimentality（过度的赞美/煽情）。在写作里，它带有一种“本来好，但因为过头而反感”的评价色彩。
词源上来自中古英语，和“因吃得太饱而倒胃口/生腻”的概念相关，所以它特别常用于食物与甜味的语境，也可引申到情感与语言（如称赞、煽情）。

summary.en: “Cloying” means unpleasantly sweet or overly sentimental.
summary.zh: “Cloying”表示“甜得发腻的”或“过于煽情、矫情到让人不舒服的”。

definition.en: Too sweet, rich, or strong in a way that becomes unpleasant; overly sentimental or “saccharine.”
definition.zh: 甜得发腻的；（感情/表达）过于煽情、矫情而让人不舒服的。

examples.en: After the first few bites, the frosting tasted cloying and made me want water.
examples.zh: 前几口还行，但糖霜很快就甜得发腻，让我想喝水。

examples.en: The movie’s cloying ending felt forced instead of touching.
examples.zh: 电影的结尾过于煽情，显得刻意而不感人。

extraExplanation: “Cloying”常用于描述食物的“过甜发腻”，也可形容言语、音乐、广告等“甜腻到让人反感”的风格。
词源上与“堵塞/使厌腻”的含义有关，所以它带有“甜到让人受不了、反而倒胃口”的感觉。写作里常与“sweet”“sentimental”形成对比：sweet=令人愉快；cloying=过头了。

summary.en: Clozapine is a prescription antipsychotic medication mainly used for treatment‑resistant schizophrenia, and it requires careful monitoring.
summary.zh: Clozapine（氯氮平）是一种处方抗精神病药，主要用于难治性精神分裂症，并需要严格监测。

definition.en: a prescription antipsychotic medicine used mainly to treat schizophrenia (especially when other medicines have not worked) and to reduce suicidal behavior in some patients
definition.zh: 一种处方抗精神病药，主要用于治疗精神分裂症（尤其是对其他药物反应不佳时），并可用于降低部分患者的自杀相关风险

examples.en: The psychiatrist prescribed clozapine after several other antipsychotics didn’t help.
examples.zh: 在几种其他抗精神病药效果不佳后，精神科医生开了氯氮平。

examples.en: Because of possible side effects, patients taking clozapine need regular blood tests.
examples.zh: 由于可能出现副作用，服用氯氮平的患者需要定期验血。

examples.en: She asked the doctor about the benefits and risks of starting clozapine.
examples.zh: 她向医生询问开始使用氯氮平的益处与风险。

extraExplanation: 氯氮平（clozapine）通常被归为“非典型抗精神病药”。它在治疗“难治性精神分裂症”方面较有代表性，但也因为潜在严重不良反应（例如白细胞/中性粒细胞减少等）而需要严格随访与抽血监测；不同国家/地区会有相应的用药管理与监测项目。
学习用法提示：在英语中它多作为不可数的药名使用（a dose of clozapine / on clozapine），通常不说“clozapines”。

summary.en: “Cloze” most commonly means a fill-in-the-blanks reading exercise (a cloze test). It can also be used as a verb meaning to turn a text into that kind of exercise.
summary.zh: “cloze”最常指“完形填空/挖空填词”这种阅读练习（cloze test），也可作动词表示“把文本改成完形填空”。

definition.en: A test or exercise where you fill in missing words in a passage, using context clues to choose the right words.
definition.zh: 完形填空：一种练习或测试形式，在一段文字中挖空，让你根据上下文把缺失的词填回去。

examples.en: We did a cloze exercise to practice reading comprehension.
examples.zh: 我们做了完形填空练习来训练阅读理解。

examples.en: In the cloze test, every seventh word was removed.
examples.zh: 在这套完形填空测试里，每隔七个词就挖掉一个。

definition.en: To create a cloze exercise by removing words from a text so learners can fill them in.
definition.zh: 把一段文字改成完形填空：从文本中删去一些词，让学习者把它们补上。

examples.en: The teacher clozed the paragraph for homework.
examples.zh: 老师把那段文字改成完形填空当作作业。

examples.en: You can cloze a news article to help students notice grammar patterns.
examples.zh: 你可以把新闻文章做成完形填空，帮助学生注意语法模式。

extraExplanation: “cloze”常用于语言学习与测评领域。它来自“closure（完形/补全）”的概念：读者会用上下文把信息“补全”，因此完形填空能测阅读理解、词汇与语法敏感度。
常见做法：按固定间隔挖空（如每第7个词删掉），或选择关键的词（如连接词、时态、固定搭配）挖空。不同做法会影响难度与测到的能力。

summary.en: Cloze is a fill-in-the-blank reading exercise; clozes can also mean “creates a cloze exercise.”
summary.zh: cloze 指“完形填空/挖空填空”的阅读练习；作动词时 clozes 表示“把文章改成完形填空”。

definition.en: a type of exercise or test where words are removed from a text and you fill in the blanks using context (a “cloze test” or “cloze passage”)
definition.zh: 一种把文章中的词挖空、让你根据上下文填空的练习/测验（完形填空；cloze test / cloze passage）

examples.en: Our teacher gave us a cloze test to practice reading comprehension.
examples.zh: 老师给了我们一份完形填空来练习阅读理解。

examples.en: This cloze passage is about climate change, so the missing words are mostly related to weather.
examples.zh: 这篇完形填空文章讲的是气候变化，所以被挖空的词大多和天气有关。

definition.en: to make a cloze exercise by removing words from a text
definition.zh: 把一段文字改编成完形填空（通过删除一些词并留空）

examples.en: The instructor clozed the article by deleting every seventh word.
examples.zh: 讲师把这篇文章改成完形填空：每隔七个词就删掉一个。

examples.en: We cloze short stories to help students learn vocabulary in context.
examples.zh: 我们把短篇故事做成完形填空，帮助学生在语境中学词汇。

extraExplanation: “cloze”读音和“close /kloʊz/”相同，但意思不同。日常英语里更常见的是 close（关闭/靠近）；你输入的“clozes”更可能是拼写错误的“closes”（close 的第三人称单数：He closes the door）。
“cloze”来自“closure”（填补/补全）的概念，语言学习与阅读测验中常用。
